.
Definition:  Deep Partial Thickness and Full Thickness Burns
Deep partial thickness burns
occur when there is complete destruction of the epidermis and severe damage to the dermal layer.
Full-thickness burns
occur when there is complete destruction of the epidermis and dermis.  There may also be damage to the underlying subcutaneous fat layer.
